item.title: Sport has a role to play in addressing harmful gender stereotypes, says Carlton defender
item.description: Carlton defender Harriet Cordner says sport has a key role to play in challenging gendered stereotypes in society, particularly given its reach within communities.

item.title: Temporary commercial and recreational fishing restrictions announced amid ongoing algal bloom
item.description: The SA government is placing temporary restrictions on fishing in the Gulf St Vincent and Spencer Gulf as results from fish stock monitoring show declining numbers of some species.

item.title: Phillip Mark Walton's family tell inquest of their heartbreak about his death in custody
item.description: The family of a man who died in police custody in northern New South Wales say they thought he had overcome his problems.

item.title: Chinese Communist Party body replaces 11 members amid corruption purge
item.description: The personnel turnover is the highest since 2017 and shows Xi's determination to crack down on corruption, say analysts.

item.title: Vodafone customer unable to ring triple-0 with Samsung phone says telco failed to help her fix problem
item.description: A Vodafone customer who was repeatedly unable to ring triple-0 says the major telco failed to help her fix the problem for months.

item.title: Melbourne crime prevention program provides mentoring for multicultural youth
item.description: Lueth Akue turned to crime during a childhood plagued by hardship. He is using his experience to help young offenders turn their lives around in Australia's "crime capital".

item.title: Coalition's climate strategy could learn from the proverb about a dog returning to its vomit
item.description: The Liberals have faced an existential crisis over climate and energy twice in recent memory. The damage must live in the memory of today's parliamentarians, who face the prospect of another episode.

item.title: The Dish still helping unravel secrets of the cosmos 25 years after film's release
item.description: The film The Dish helped reintroduce a new generation of Australians to the critical role the Parkes Observatory played in the Moon landing. Twenty-five years after its release, the film has had a lasting impact.

item.title: How to tell if a book is valuable
item.description: There are many factors that can determine the monetary value of a book, so what can make an edition worth tens of thousands of dollars?

item.title: Donald Trump's trade moves with China put South-East Asian countries in the crossfire
item.description: As US President Donald Trump visits South-East Asia amid global trade tensions, Indonesian exporters worry the region could bear the brunt of his protectionist policies.

item.title: Women push for flexible construction jobs amid building delays in NSW
item.description: Experts say unlocking flexible hours, gender diversity and migrant workers could help Australia meet its housing targets.

item.title: Australia is all in on AUKUS. In Donald Trump's America, it's more complicated
item.description: In Washington on Monday, Anthony Albanese made something clear once again: Australia is all-in on the trilateral defence pact. Clarifying what US powerbrokers think remains a multi-billion-dollar question.

item.title: Traditional owners handed more than 900,000ha of Cape York land after 255 years
item.description: A native title claim in the region where Captain James Cook made landfall after his ship crashed into the Great Barrier Reef in 1770 is among one of three to finally be settled by the Federal Court this week.

item.title: Three men charged with murder of Bankstown woman Thi Kim Tran
item.description: Three men have been charged with murder after a Sydney woman was kidnapped and killed over her husband's drug debt earlier this year.

item.title: NSW program helps mothers restore dignity, rebuild lives outside of prison
item.description: The program from the Women's and Girls' Emergency Centre helps pregnant women in, or at risk of incarceration find safe accommodation and keep families together.

item.title: ASX closes Friday lower but hits second consecutive week of gains, Trump terminates trade talks with Canada — as it happened
item.description: The Australian share market finishes Friday lower but the week higher after Tuesday's record gains, as US President Donald Trump takes to social media to declare trade negotiations with Canada over.

item.title: Sydney 2000 Paralympics changed everything for the Paralympic movement
item.description: Sydney 2000 was a turning point — not just for me, but for the entire Paralympic movement, writes silver medallist Elizabeth Wright.

item.title: NBA head coach Chauncey Billups, player Terry Rozier arrested over sports betting
item.description: Portland coach Chauncey Billups and Miami Heat guard Terry Rozier are among more than 30 people arrested in two cases alleging sprawling criminal schemes to rake in millions by rigging sports bets and poker games.

item.title: Innovators rethink bike seat design to combat cycling saddle pain
item.description: "Saddle soreness" is a common complaint among cyclists. These innovators are looking at creative ways to prevent it by redesigning the bike seat.

item.title: ADHD support groups help women in Geraldton navigate life after diagnosis
item.description: Jessie Carrie could not find the support she needed after being diagnosed with ADHD as an adult, so she started groups to help others.

item.title: Mudgee's Regent Theatre bought by residents with big plans for grand revival
item.description: After sitting idle for two decades residents of the NSW town of Mudgee have purchased the iconic Regent Theatre, with plans to return it to its former glory.

item.title: Construction sector taskforce investigate burglary at home of investigative journalist
item.description: Victoria Police are investigating a burglary at the home of award-winning journalist Nick McKenzie.

item.title: Dolphins frolic with sea sponges on heads in unique mating tactic off WA coast
item.description: Scientists observe male humpback dolphins parading sea sponges on their heads to impress females off Western Australia's northern coast.

item.title: Australia backs Pacific Islands facing China heat over Taiwan
item.description: Beijing reprimanded Pacific Island nation ambassadors for including Taiwan in the regional summit last month, but Australia and New Zealand have lent their support.

item.title: Deadly H5 strain of bird flu suspected on sub-Antarctic Heard Island in the Southern Ocean
item.description: Suspected bird flu has reached Australia's sub-Antarctic Heard Island, with signs of the deadly H5 avian disease observed in elephant seals.

item.title: A-League footballers' mental health and substance abuse concerns revealed in PFA report
item.description: Socceroos hero Andrew Redmayne sheds light on the stresses A-League players face after a report finds footballers are struggling with their mental health, substance abuse and job security issues.

item.title: US imposes more sanctions on Russia as Ukraine war continues
item.description: The Russian president acknowledged that the move to sanction two oil companies would have "certain consequences", but would not significantly impact the country's economy.

item.title: Man charged over stabbing death of housemate on southern Gold Coast
item.description: A 27-year-old man has faced court on the Gold Coast, charged with murder after his 57-year-old housemate was found dead with stab wounds at a unit.

item.title: India qualifies for Women's World Cup semifinal after double-century partnership from opening pair
item.description: Smriti Mandhana scores her third century of the World Cup as a monster partnership with fellow opener Pratika Rawal delivers India a crucial win against New Zealand.

item.title: Survivor calls for greater awareness of strokes in young people
item.description: Despite one in four sufferers being under 65, experts say there is a common misconception that strokes only occur in older people. Mental well-being is key to recovery but is often more difficult for younger stroke survivors.

item.title: First Nations women share healing stories to pave bright tourism future
item.description: A growing number of women are entering the in-demand cultural tourism field in which First Nations guides share treasured knowledge.

item.title: Cranky crow forces visitors to Noosa's Hastings Street to duck for cover
item.description: Noosa Council has received multiple reports of the crow swooping walkers, which experts say is unusual for the species.

item.title: Ex-employees accuse Kimberley service station of hygiene breaches
item.description: Steve Pates has worked in kitchens all around Australia, but says what he witnessed at a business in WA's far north was beyond anything he had ever seen.

item.title: Kangaroo Nawaqanitawase will earn Wallabies recall in 2027, says Les Kiss
item.description: Wallabies coach-in-waiting Les Kiss is an admirer of Kangaroos debutant Mark Nawaqanitawase, who he says will return to union in 2027 wiser and a better player.

item.title: Staff in regional ACM newsrooms concerned about rollout of generative AI model
item.description: Staff and a union say a generative AI model being tested in Australian Community Media's regional newspapers is misattributing facts and leaving some fearing for their jobs.

item.title: Police warn wave of kill crew plots break 'no families' gangland code
item.description: The alleged murder of a woman who was stripped naked, bound and gagged before she was killed shows a wider trend that Sydney's "guns for hire" are willing to break gangland code, a senior NSW detective says.

item.title: Mount Gibson announces 450 redundancies due to Koolan Island mine closure
item.description: A rockfall prompts Mount Gibson Iron to wind down operations at its Koolan Island mine in WA's far north earlier than expected, with 450 workers made redundant.

item.title: Suspected arson attack on Bega home, weeks after fatal stabbing on same street
item.description: A fire that destroyed a house on the NSW far south coast is being treated as suspicious, after a man was fatally stabbed on the same street earlier in the month.

item.title: Woman charged with murder, arson over Gladstone house fire in central Queensland
item.description: A woman has been charged with murder and arson after a house fire that took the lives of a woman and two young children in Gladstone.

item.title: Video appears to show Louvre jewel thieves escaping on ladder in broad daylight
item.description: Video shared widely on social media appears to show alleged Louvre jewellery thieves escaping on a crane near the Seine.

item.title: Rare dinosaur mummies help scientists recreate what the prehistoric creatures may have looked like
item.description: The duck-billed dinosaur was only a few years old when it died. Scientists now believe the species had hooves on its feet.

item.title: Police launch fresh search in cold case murder of Colleen Walker-Craig
item.description: A search is underway on NSW Mid North Coast for the remains of Colleen Walker-Craig, who went missing within months of two other children in Bowraville.

item.title: US faces a reckoning after blurring line between gambling and sport
item.description: Seven years ago, the United States crossed a line that it once dared to never cross, leading to a string of arrests that threaten to tarnish sports in the country for generations to come.

item.title: Rough sleeping camps found burnt in Launceston
item.description: Two homeless camps in Launceston were found burnt, and with the social housing waitlist growing and more people calling for help, advocates say the situation is at breaking point.

item.title: Andrew Forrest's $1b Clarke Creek Wind Farm opens in central Queensland
item.description: After three years of construction, one of the biggest wind farms in the country has been switched on. The large-scale project has not been without controversy.

item.title: Canada ready to resume US trade talks halted by Trump over TV ad
item.description: The US president has used tariffs as leverage on many countries around the world.

item.title: How these families organise cooking to make weeknight dinners easier
item.description: Precision meal planning is not for every household and these family cooks say there are other ways to make mealtimes easier.

item.title: WA town of Kununurra in crime crisis with 17 juvenile arrests in 72 hours over car thefts
item.description: Children as young as 10 have been arrested as stolen vehicles are driven recklessly at police cars.

item.title: Satellite images show White House's East Wing has been demolished for Donald Trump's ballroom
item.description: The demolition has sparked angry backlash from Democrats and raised questions about whether the Trump administration followed proper protocols.

item.title: Childcare workers charged after allegedly assaulting toddler at Little Zak's Academy in Western Sydney
item.description: Little Zak's Academy said it had "zero tolerance" for any conduct that compromised the wellbeing of a child.

item.description: Minjee Lee and Steph Kyriacou edge a star-studded Team Australia closer to the semifinals at the prestigious International Crown in Seoul.

item.title: Woman extradited to Queensland over alleged Chinese authority and law enforcement impersonation scam
item.description: Police say they've been investigating reports about scammers impersonating Chinese police officers or authority figures.

item.title: Friday Finance with David Chau
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: WA company TLC Surface Treatment fined almost $1m over death of 16yo Hamiora Sharland
item.description: A sandblasting and spray-painting business is fined more than $1 million over the death of a teenager who was critically injured at a Perth factory.

item.title: Environment report author 'bitterly disappointed' by Coalition, Greens opposition to government's reforms
item.description: The man tasked with reviewing Australia's environment laws back when the opposition leader was minister, says he is "bitterly disappointed" she is pushing back on the reforms.

item.title: Authorities identify homemade foods believed to be linked to Queensland rat poisoning cluster
item.description: Queensland Health says three of the five people who presented to hospital with brodifacoum poisoning last week consumed two homemade dishes which later tested positive to the toxin.

item.title: Indy Tahau breaks AFLW goal-kicking record as Port upsets Adelaide by seven points
item.description: Indy Tahau breaks the AFLW home-and-away season goal-kicking record in Port's breakthrough seven-point defeat of Adelaide.

item.title: US warns of more killings as it strikes another alleged drug-running boat in the Caribbean
item.description: The frequency of the strikes has increased from one every few weeks in September to three in one week now.

item.title: Albanese heads to summit where Asia's response to Trump's tariffs is on full display
item.description: The unintended consequences of Donald Trump's tariffs may be the exact opposite of what was intended: closer links between ASEAN countries and China, and the creation of an even bigger manufacturing hub in south-east Asia.

item.title: Sussan Ley is Labor's best bet on environmental laws as deal with Greens carries risk
item.description: If the Coalition is indeed the living corpse it so often resembles, Watt and his boss Anthony Albanese will have little choice but to sit down with the Greens, a party they often seem to loathe even more than the Liberals, and do a deal.

item.title: Hamas will disarm but only if a Palestinian state is promised, spokesperson says
item.description: Hamas has quickly re-established de facto control of much of Gaza since the recent ceasefire. But a spokesperson says the militant group does not want to govern Gaza into the future.

item.title: Spring rain on the horizon for Australia's weather as La Niña battles Antarctic warming
item.description: A predicted wetter-than-normal season has failed to materialise, and much of NSW, Queensland and the NT are sweating through their hottest October on record.

item.title: OnlyFans 'sugar daddy' and his wife embroiled in $61 million tax mischief
item.description: A Gold Coast house purchased for an OnlyFans creator by a small-town businessman is among 20 properties frozen by the Federal Court in a $61 million tax case.

item.title: Our country's 50,000-year-old encyclopedia
item.description: There are more than 2 million artworks on the rocks at Murujuga, with more stories under the waves.

item.title: Why the 'Prince Andrew problem' is one King Charles 'has to confront'
item.description: In a week where King Charles said he hoped to project unity as a "bulwark against those promoting conflict, division and tyranny", his scandal-ridden brother reigned supreme.

item.title: Northern Australia warned to prepare as heatwave weekend tipped
item.description: As a "silent killer" blankets large parts of Australia's north this weekend, medical professionals urge people to plan ahead and stay hydrated.

item.title: The Hobart Clinic failed an audit before CEO was fired and board attempted to wind it up, documents show
item.description: Documents obtained by the ABC show a failed audit at Tasmania's only large-scale private mental health facility, claims that staff concerns were ignored, and the lead-up to the departure of its CEO.

item.title: Analysts say gold chasing shares to record highs is eroding its crucial safe haven status
item.description: A major investment bank says gold is following share markets higher. While the precious metal consistently pushes record highs, it suggests the gold price could continue to rise substantially. But what's really at stake?

item.title: Food subsidies set to run dry as second-longest US government shutdown drags on
item.description: The government shutdown is continuing in the US and some of the worst effects are yet to be felt.

item.title: ABC Quote Quiz: Gifts for Trump, unpopular royals, a new-look BOM site and helping skates mate
item.description: They said it, we published it. Can you decipher it? See if you can work out who said what, and why.

item.title: MS is not holding Lynda MacCallum back from staying in the saddle
item.description: Told she would never ride again after a multiple sclerosis diagnosis, horse trainer Lynda MacCallum is still defying the odds seven years later.

item.title: Will Australia's $3bn critical minerals deal with Trump pay off?
item.description: Anthony Albanese and Donald Trump were all smiles as they inked a $3 billion critical minerals deal touted as a good deal for all. But has Australia drawn the short end of the stick?

item.title: The unexpected hurdle meaning a NSW musician is ineligible for a government grant
item.description: Jennifer Hankin was hoping to apply for a NSW government grant program to support local recording artists so she could finally release her EP.

item.title: AI robots enlisted in fight against sea urchin surge along Australia's east coast
item.description: A hidden environmental crisis lurks beneath the crystal clear waters of Australia's east coast as long-spined sea urchins wreak havoc on the coast. Now scientists are trialling a new solution.

item.title: How a billion-dollar dream blew up a friendship between financial advisor Jason Sourasis and AFL star Scott Pendlebury
item.description: Former Magpies skipper Scott Pendlebury has hired one of Australia's most high-profile commercial lawyers to claim millions that he alleges his former confidant misappropriated.

item.title: Nine candidates running for Townsville mayor at postal by-election
item.description: Townsville residents will select from a field of nine candidates at a mayoral by-election next month.

item.title: Russian envoy says Trump, Putin meeting will likely happen 'at a later date'
item.description: A top Moscow official says he believes the US, Ukraine and Russia are close to a "diplomatic solution" on the conflict.

item.title: A jewellery heist story can feel like a guilt-free treat
item.description: I bet you've never spent as much time in your entire life ruminating over a brooch as you have this week.

item.title: Best books out in October, from Jane Harper, Kiran Desai, Bri Lee and more
item.description: Wondering what to read? This month's best books include the latest from Jane Harper, Bri Lee and Booker Prize winner Kiran Desai.

item.title: Tasmania remains free of H5 bird flu, but returning migratory birds could pose a risk
item.description: With migratory birds returning to Tasmania during a period of increased bird flu, the chance of the virus affecting the state's coastal areas is on the rise.

item.title: How the star of lost silent film Jewelled Nights went from the limelight to selling sweets for cinemagoers
item.description: Australia's first Hollywood star, a famous romance novel by Joh Bjelke-Petersen's aunt and a rare alloy mined from Tasmania's west coast put the island's wild places on the big screen.

item.title: Fire ant eradication program under scrutiny as woman left fighting infestation alone
item.description: A Queensland woman says she has been left to fight a fire ant infestation with virtually no support, as experts warn funding gaps and slow responses risk wider spread.

item.title: Alex de Minaur beats Matteo Berrettini in Vienna, sets up Jannik Sinner clash for place in final
item.description: Alex de Minaur reaches his 30th ATP tour semifinal in Vienna with a big win over Matteo Berrettini -- but he will have to get past his nemesis Jannik Sinner for a place in the final.

item.title: Nationwide Bug Hunt to capture Australia's insect, invertebrate underworld
item.description: Australia's photographic natural database is about to get a big boost as citizen scientists are urged to join a national search.

item.title: 'Castle Law' petition closes with record support in Queensland
item.description: A second attempt to put "castle law" before Queensland parliament has generated record support, with some legal experts concerned.

item.title: Trailblazing female mining engineer remembered as pioneering transgender woman
item.description: The mining industry is notoriously "bloke-centred". Rebecca Norton transitioned gender and kept going.

item.title: NSW seeks federal support for world-first mRNA foot and mouth disease vaccine
item.description: Scientists in NSW develop a potential world-first mRNA vaccine to protect cattle from foot and mouth disease.

item.title: What does it mean if a deadly strain of bird flu has been found on Australia's Heard Island?
item.description: Scientists suspect a deadly strain of bird flu, H5N1, has infected wildlife on Heard Island after observing a high mortality rate in elephant seals on the Australian territory in the sub-Antarctic.

item.title: 'Balenciaga Bikie' Tarek Zahed arrested in Sydney's north-west after month-long manhunt
item.description: Tarek Zahed was arrested at a property in Dundas Valley on Friday night, NSW Police said. Warrants for his apprehension had been issued in two states.

item.title: Sam Kerr set for Matildas return against Wales after nearly two years out with injury
item.description: Sam Kerr is back with the Matildas and ready to start taking big steps towards a dream of lifting silverware with the current group of players.

item.title: Trump sending US carrier to Latin America as war fears rise
item.description: It is a major escalation in a US military build-up in the Caribbean, with Venezuela's leader warning the Trump administration is "fabricating a war".

item.title: Menindee Lakes birdwatcher, the 'Birdman', has recorded 200-plus bird species
item.description: For 50 years Geoff Looney has called the remote Indigenous community of Menindee in Far West New South Wales home. Thirty years ago he started recording information about birdlife in the region which has grown to more than 209 species recorded.

item.title: Perth Festival venues include vacant offices, bridges, secret locations in 2026
item.description: Perth Festival unveils a diverse program making use of unconventional event spaces, but large-scale opening and closing events are markedly missing this year.

item.title: New York Attorney-General Letitia James pleads not guilty in mortgage fraud case pushed by Trump
item.description: Speaking to supporters outside the court following brief arraignment, Letitia James said the Trump administration is using the justice system as a "vehicle of retribution".

item.title: Thailand's Queen Mother Sirikit dies after blood infection, aged 93
item.description: Sirikit, who succumbed to a blood infection, is remembered as a champion of the poor.

item.title: Study tracks how foxes 'colonised' Australia and grew to a population of 1.7 million
item.description: A nationwide program has traced how foxes spread from south-eastern Australia to as far away as the Pilbara in just 70 years, as part of efforts to revive native species populations decimated by the pest.

item.title: Surfing with the Mob connects Indigenous teens to country and language on NSW far south coast
item.description: It started with a surf lesson, but these these Indigenous teens found something far deeper in the ocean.

item.description: The US rocker says getting back to form after the surgical procedure was a long, slow process.

item.title: Kangaroos vs England, kick-off time and how to watch, Australia meets Bon Jovi at Wembley before Ashes Test
item.description: The countdown is on for the first Ashes series in 22 years, as the Kangaroos look to retain the title they have held since 1973.

item.title: Marking 40 years since the historic handback of Uluṟu-Kata Tjuṯa
item.description: When you drive towards Uluṟu and see the stark, red monolith on the horizon, or stand at its base and look up at its striking, powerful enormity, time stands still.

item.title: Perth Zoo's Sumatran tiger Jaya dies of cancer, seven years after tumour removed
item.description: Perth Zoo's beloved Sumatran tiger Jaya dies, seven years after being diagnosed with cancer and nine years after his mother also died of the disease.

item.title: Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma lead India to nine-wicket victory over Australia in third ODI
item.description: Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma conclude their Australian farewell tour with an unbeaten 169-run partnership in India's commanding nine-wicket victory at the Sydney Cricket Ground.

item.title: Mollie O'Callaghan breaks freestyle 200m short course world record for second time in one week
item.description: Mollie O'Callaghan caps a brilliant week at the swimming World Cup in Toronto, setting a new short-course world record in the 200-metre women's freestyle.

item.title: Popular podcasters are calling out Trump — will young men follow suit?
item.description: Wildly popular podcasters such as Joe Rogan, Andrew Schulz and Theo Von have distanced themselves from the Trump administration in recent months.

item.title: Community gathers in Gladstone for woman, two boys allegedly murdered in house fire
item.description: A central Queensland community gathers to mourn a mum, her son and his best friend who died in a house fire. A woman has been charged with murder and arson.

item.title: Swans keep season alive with 17-point defeat of Eagles as Hawks, Lions and Dockers notch victories
item.description: The Sydney Swans beat the West Coast Eagles by 17 points to keep their hopes of playing in this year's AFLW finals series alive, while Fremantle, Brisbane and Hawthorn also pick up wins.

item.title: Apartment construction scheme unveiled by SA government ahead of 2026 election
item.description: A scheme to increase housing supply by boosting confidence in apartment construction projects in Adelaide's CBD has been unveiled by the SA government as a major election commitment — but the opposition has questioned the affordability of the proposal.

item.description: In the first stop on their spring tour, the Wallabies hold on for a gritty 19-15 victory over Japan in wet conditions at Tokyo's National Stadium.

item.title: Halloween toys fail safety tests, prompting warning to parents
item.description: Authorities warn parents of the dangers of Halloween-themed toys bought online, after testing reveals 80 per cent fail to meet safety and information standards.

item.title: Donald Trump says he does not forget when people 'say bad' about him, in response to question about Kevin Rudd
item.description: US President Donald Trump says he does not forget when people "say bad" things about him, in response to a question about Australia's ambassador, Kevin Rudd.

item.title: Thunderstorms disrupt Harvest Rock and OzAsia festivals in Adelaide's CBD
item.description: A burst of stormy weather causes interruptions at Adelaide's Harvest Rock music event and the OzAsia Festival, amid more downpours in other parts of the state.

item.title: Cricket Australia says two Women's World Cup members were 'touched inappropriately' in India
item.description: Cricket Australia says two members of the Australian Women's World Cup cricket team have been "touched inappropriately" in India.

item.title: Worker dies at Merredin grain property owned by WA farmer John Nicoletti
item.description: A man in his 60s died at a property owned by prominent farmer John Nicoletti in Western Australia's Wheatbelt.

item.title: Alana King spins Australia to crushing seven-wicket victory against South Africa in ODI World Cup
item.description: Alana King claims the best figures by an Australian woman in ODI history as Australia defeats South Africa by seven wickets to book a semi-final clash with India.

item.title: 'Change is hard, but progress occurs': Albanese chats land rights on NT visit
item.description: Crowds gather to celebrate the anniversary of a pivotal moment in the Aboriginal land rights movements, as the prime minister speaks from Uluṟu for the first time since the failed referendum.

item.title: Matildas beat Wales 2-1 in Cardiff as Sam Kerr makes successful return from injury
item.description: Sam Kerr makes a successful return to action with the Matildas, starting and playing an hour in Australia's 2-1 win over Wales.

item.title: Kangaroos crush England 26-6 to claim 1-0 series lead in rugby league Ashes series at Wembley stadium
item.description: Reece Walsh scored two tries and saved two more as the Kangaroos belted England 26-6 in front of a record crowd at Wembley Stadium in London.

item.title: Anthony Albanese heads to Malaysia for ASEAN and East Asia Summit
item.description: Speaking ahead of the trip, Mr Albanese said he would use the summits to discuss economic growth, security, and stability.

item.title: Myanmar too low on agenda as regional leaders meet Trump for summit
item.description: Instead of talking about Myanmar, the US president and his regional counterparts will be congratulating themselves for helping Thailand and Cambodia strike a peace deal.

item.title: Year 12 exams have started for the Class of 2025 who began high school in COVID lockdown
item.description: They started high school as the world went into lockdown, interrupting their young lives at a pivotal moment. Now they’re graduating year 12 and figuring out what to do next.

item.title: Prince Andrew has been excised from the royal family. Should the monarchy do more?
item.description: The Prince Andrew debacle is shameful for the monarchy — it's not a pile-on, it's alleged paedophilia. So should the royals do more, here?

item.title: Georgia's surrogacy clinics attract hundreds of Australians but ethical questions remain
item.description: The international surrogacy market attracts hundreds of Australians each year, but one country in particular has become a top destination for people wishing to start their families.

item.title: West Bank community left reeling after Palestinian woman clubbed by masked Israeli settler
item.description: Settler violence against Palestinians in the West Bank ramps up every year during olive harvest, but a brazen attack caught on camera has left the community shaken.

item.title: Shooter Jennings releases unheard Waylon Jennings recordings on new album Songbird
item.description: Shooter Jennings unearthed a treasure trove of unreleased recordings from his legendary father Waylon, revealing a tender, soulful side of the outlaw icon that history forgot.

item.title: Amid anger over corruption and inequality, Asia's gen Z turns on political 'nepo babies'
item.description: Gen Zs in several Asian countries launch an online war against political "nepo babies" who flaunt their wealth on social media.

item.title: DV victim and Brisbane Lions member calls for more privacy after alleged stalking incident
item.description: Two years after she took out a domestic violence order against her ex-partner, Aurora realised he was working 10m from her reserved seat at the Gabba — she believes he accessed her details by calling the club’s membership line.

item.title: Trump says NYC primary winner Mamdani is 'a communist'
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Zohran Mamdani may soon be NYC's first Muslim millennial mayor. It's part of his appeal
item.description: If Zohran Mamdani wins, he will become New York's first Muslim and millennial mayor. It's something his campaign has been acutely aware of as he taps into new voting bases.

item.title: Child sex doll heads sold as model mannequins to harness loophole
item.description: Child sexual abuse doll heads are being sold on Temu as hairdressing model mannequins to harness a legal loophole, according to experts who say it is part of an "unhealthy culture".

item.title: Farmers buy local pub to help foster connection in country NSW
item.description: Operating a pub is no mean feat, but try doing it while running a farm at the same time. That is exactly what farmers Karen and Rowan Alcock have done in their town of Bemboka on the New South Wales far south coast.

item.title: F1 Mexico qualifying: Oscar Piastri starts seventh, Lando Norris on pole, Max Verstappen fifth
item.description: Britain's Lando Norris has dominated qualifying in Mexico to take pole position for Monday morning's grand prix, putting championship leader Oscar Piastri under pressure.

item.title: Alex de Minaur loses to Jannik Sinner in Vienna Open semifinal
item.description: Alex de Minaur's Vienna Open ends at the semifinal stage, with the Australian falling to world number one Jannik Sinner for the 12th time in as many meetings.

item.title: Lauren Huxley's brutal attacker Robert Black Farmer is up for parole next year
item.description: It has been 20 years since Lauren Huxley was brutally attacked in her home as a teen in a crime that shocked Australia. She has built a life no-one thought possible, but now her hard-won peace could be tested.

item.title: Tens of thousands to pack stadium for Punjabi singer Diljit Dosanjh's Western Sydney show
item.description: The pop sensation has an army of fans all over the world who see him as an artist who bridges cultural gaps — Diljit Dosanjh's music loved by both Indians and non-Indians alike.

item.title: Runner Sissy Austin reunited with paramedic who helped her after horrific assault near Ballarat
item.description: When Sissy Austin, a young Aboriginal woman, was left dizzied and bloodied by an unprovoked assault while running, a small gesture from an attending paramedic helped her feel safe. It's a lesson that underpins a small but significant change in how paramedics treat patients across Victoria.

item.title: Hard Quiz: Convinced your losing streak is finally over? We'll see about that
item.description: We both know you're hoping for the best with this week's quiz. Just remember, hope will get you nowhere.

item.title: Ex-MP Troy Bell will spend time in prison, joining short list of jailed politicians
item.description: Hard-working and charismatic former politician Troy Bell was so well liked, he was twice re-elected while awaiting trial for stealing public money. Now, he joins a short list of former SA politicians who have served time for crime.

item.title: Will the art of biography be lost when AI and algorithms control our data?
item.description: How will the work of biographers change as letters, diaries and photographs are replaced by emails, texts and snapshots on the cloud?

item.title: Thai cave rescuer Richard Harris explores risk-taking in the film Deeper
item.description: A new documentary by director Jennifer Peedom delves deep into the attraction of cave diving, and why Richard Harris says risk-taking is crucial for resilience.

item.title: Logan City Council resident concerned about flood map accuracy as review draws to a close
item.description: Concerns that draft flood maps don't reflect historical accounts from residents have informed some of the submissions.

item.title: Trump punishes Canada with 10pc tariff increase over TV ad stoush
item.description: US President Donald Trump says he plans to hike tariffs on imports of Canadian goods by an extra 10 per cent because of an anti-tariff television ad aired by the province of Ontario.

item.title: Staff at Tasmania's public hospitals say physical and verbal abuse a normalised part of the job
item.description: Staff at Tasmania's public hospital emergency departments say they experience violence and aggression "all the time". Data released under right to information laws shows how often these incidents are occurring.

item.title: Walking netball adaptation helping players stay on the court
item.description: Before they take the court, the Magnolias strap on knee braces and tie bows in their hair. But don't be deceived, they're playing one of the 'most competitive games', and there may be elbows thrown.

item.title: Return to traditional birthing practices brings joy to Bundjalung mothers, elders
item.description: Bundjalung babies get the ceremonial treatment as proud elders welcome them to country for the first time.

item.title: Man seriously injured in suspected machete brawl in Melbourne's Broadmeadows
item.description: Police are investigating a suspected machete brawl after a 19-year-old man was found with serious injuries.

item.title: Ancient tree stumps showing sea level change exposed on popular Esperance beach
item.description: Harsh winter weather has exposed almost 100 preserved trees from an ancient wetland on an Esperance beach, but there are fears over protecting the site on a popular four-wheel drive stretch.

item.title: Winter weather exposes ancient tree stumps
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: It's been 20 years since the Cronulla Riots. So what have we learned?
item.description: It's been 20 years since violence erupted on the streets of Cronulla after thousands gathered in a public display to "reclaim their beach" from specific migrant communities. So, what has changed?

item.title: Soccer program creates change for young people in remote communities
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Football program named after trailblazing Aboriginal soccer star John Moriarty creates change in remote communities
item.description: Trailblazing Aboriginal soccer star and Yanyuwa man John Moriarty started a soccer program which has been driving change in remote communities across the country.

item.title: Father and son grow delicate citrus blossoms for niche liqueur market
item.description: Farmers and distillers collaborate to capture a delicate flower's flavour for the boutique drinks market.

item.title: Eric Abetz's first budget for Tasmania is coming, with community organisations concerned over savings drive
item.description: Eric Abetz's first budget for Tasmania is coming — and community organisations fear they'll bear the brunt of funding cuts to "repair" the budget.

item.title: June Lockhart, beloved mother figure from Lassie and Lost In Space, dies aged 100
item.description: Lockhart died on Thursday of natural causes at her home in Santa Monica, a family spokesperson says.

item.title: Albany woman wins international wildlife photography award for second time
item.description: An Albany photographer has won an international wildlife photo award for her image of a five-headed caterpillar that was in her backyard.

item.title: Driving simulator assists people with disabilities to get behind the wheel
item.description: More than 20 regional NDIS clients have gone on to get their L-plates since completing a course with a unique driving simulator.

item.title: Exoskeletons including high-tech glove trialled to reduce workplace injuries
item.description: An ordinary worker puts on a power suit and gains extra strength. It sounds like the plot of a superhero film, but this is no work of fiction.

item.title: In the housing debate between NIMBYs and YIMBYs, a map of Sydney shows what's at stake
item.description: In the debate about Sydney's housing situation and the protection of the city's heritage buildings and suburbs, there's a map that does the rounds.

item.title: Nationals' net zero review has not undertaken economic modelling
item.description: Nationals Senator Matt Canavan will present parts of his and Ross Cadell's net zero review to the party room when parliament resumes on Monday.

item.title: Mount Gambier's St Andrew's Uniting Church to be sold due to steeple repair cost
item.description: The tallest church in Mount Gambier will be sold so the congregation and its pastor can focus on their Christian mission rather than paying to repair its 154-year-old building's rickety steeple.

item.title: Tiny home dream shattered for WA woman with epilepsy as council orders removal
item.description: A tiny home which began as a dream for Kathryn Payne becomes little more than a $130,000 storage unit in her dad's front yard as a local council in Perth's north demands the structure be removed.

item.title: 10yo boy holds toy train exhibition at local pub to raise funds for sick children
item.description: In the main room of a local pub in the western Victorian town of Natimuk, Brock Mewett shows off his toy trains to raise money for the Royal Children's Hospital.

item.title: Lani Pallister and Kaylee McKeown set world records at short course swimming World Cup in Toronto
item.description: Lani Pallister and Kaylee McKeown have continued Australia's record breaking run at the short course swimming World Cup in Toronto.

item.title: 11yo boy from West Australia's Wheatbelt restores FJ45 LandCruiser
item.description: After-school restoration fun wins 11-year-old Wheatbelt mini-mechanic Harry Strange best in show.

item.title: Kamala Harris says she may run for US presidency again but hasn't made up her mind
item.description: The former US vice-president won't commit to making another bid for the White House yet, but reiterates she's "not done" with public service.

item.title: Meet the 2025 Agrifutures Rural Women's Award national finalists
item.description: Meet the national finalists in the running for the 2025 AgriFutures Rural Women's Award celebrating change-makers in rural, regional and remote Australia.

item.title: Death of child trapped in fence at childcare centre ruled 'preventable'
item.description: The family of a 22-month-old girl who died at a Northern Territory child care centre last year are calling on the government to ban the type of fencing that caused her death under the banner of "Ebony's Law".

item.title: Reece Walsh hailed a 'freak of a player' after Kangaroos defeat England 26-6 in first Ashes Test
item.description: Nathan Cleary and Cameron Munster heap praise on Kangaroos teammate Reece Walsh following his stunning Test debut against England at Wembley.

item.title: Man charged with murder over alleged stabbing of woman in Broome
item.description: A 56-year-old man is charged with murder over the death of a woman in Western Australia's far north.

item.title: Electricity cut to hundreds on Yorke Peninsula when car hit Stobie pole
item.description: An allegedly unlicensed driver will face court after he crashed into a Stobie pole at Minlaton on SA's Yorke Peninsula, cutting the power supply to surrounding areas, police say.

item.title: Anthony Albanese dismisses lingering questions about relationship between Donald Trump and Kevin Rudd
item.description: The prime minister batted away concerns over Kevin Rudd's future after Donald Trump said he does not forget when people "say bad" things about him.

item.title: What you told us about receiving mail for a previous home owner or renter
item.description: From feeling "harassed" to fraudulent activity, this is what you had to say about how receiving mail that is not yours has impacted your life.

item.description: US President Donald Trump and Prime Minister Anthony Albanese touch down in the Malaysian capital of Kuala Lumpur ahead of the annual summit of the Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN).
